text:
Nearly every day the apache process crashes when mod_deflate is loaded and 
active.
You can watch as the processes consume more and more RAM and sometime the 
server doesn't answer any http requests anymore. Restarting apache doesn't 
help. I have to restart the machine.

Windows Event Log:
Error in Queue: faulting application Apache.exe, Version 2.0.53.0, faulting 
module mod_deflate.so, Version 2.0.53.0, error code 0x0000115a. 

error.log (debug)

[Tue Apr 19 19:52:30 2005] [notice] Parent: child process exited with status 
3221226324 -- Restarting.
creator: stke@gmx.li
trawick@apache.org
text:
Unfortunately, there are few people hanging out here who know how to
definitively debug crashes on Windows.  I don't see any subsequent fixes in
2.0.x which would resolve a crash in mod_deflate.

Does anyone recall if this change (in 2.1-dev but not 2.0.x) fixes a crash?

  *) mod_deflate: Don't deflate responses with zero length
     e.g. proxied 304's [Allan Edwards]

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
That's just a correctness fix not a crash fix.  I don't know of any mod_deflate
memory leaks either.  Can you post the mod_deflate configuration you're using,
Stefan?  You're sure it's not triggered when mod_deflate is not loaded?

creator: stke@gmx.li
text:
This is my config:

AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/plain
BrowserMatch ^Mozilla/4 gzip-only-text/html 
BrowserMatch ^Mozilla/4\.0[678] no-gzip 
BrowserMatch \bMSIE !no-gzip !gzip-only-text/html 

SetOutputFilter DEFLATE
SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \.(?:gif|jpe?g|png|rar|zip|pdf)$ no-gzip
<IfModule mod_headers.c>
 Header append Vary User-Agent
</IfModule>

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
can you get a traceback?  We don't have a clue where to look without one, 
unless someone can reproduce a similar crash - and we don't know what else 
you're running.

(In reply to comment #6)
> can you get a traceback?  We don't have a clue where to look without one, 
> unless someone can reproduce a similar crash - and we don't know what else 
> you're running. 

Hi,

what do you mean with traceback?
creator: stke@gmx.li

text:
Tonight I'll write something about how-to-use Dr. Watson and the -symbols.zip
  file on Win32 so any user can create a backtrace, and so they learn how to
  send on the user.dmp file when requested.  Stay tuned, I'll update you here.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
This looks like a loose end.  Stefan, any news?  Either a traceback, or a more
recent Apache version working for you?
creator: nick@webthing.com
nick@webthing.com
text:
No response to NEEDINFO; assuming no longer applicable.  Please reopen with
traceback if you can reproduce it in current versions.
